intro: Hesperastragalus obispensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, bean-shaped pods that contain several seeds. Hesperastragalus obispensis is often found in sagebrush steppe and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and potential medicinal significance.
